name: ListPagerdutyAddons
description:
Retrieve all installed add-ons on your PagerDuty account.

Use this tool to get a list of all add-ons currently installed on your PagerDuty account. Add-ons are extensions that add functionality to the PagerDuty UI. This should be called when you need to view or manage these add-ons. OAuth scope required: `addons.read`.

parameters.name: api_version
parameters.description: The API version to accept; used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Sets the content type for the request. Must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of add-ons to display per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset for starting pagination in search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: include_additional_models
parameters.description: Specify additional models to include in the response. Valid value: 'services'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: filter_by_service_ids
parameters.description: List of service IDs to filter results, showing only Add-ons associated with these services.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only Add-ons for the given services

parameters.name: addon_type_filter
parameters.description: Filter results to show only Add-ons of a specific type, such as 'full_page_addon' or 'incident_show_addon'.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only Add-ons of the given type

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to include the total number of add-ons in the response. Default is false for faster responses.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: service_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only Add-ons for the given services

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only Add-ons for the given services

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only Add-ons of the given type

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only Add-ons of the given type

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
